resources.name: Town of Boonton Food Pantry
resources.description: Weekly food distribution for Boonton residents.
resources.eligibility: Boonton residents and families in need

resources.name: Loaves & Fishes Community Food Pantry
resources.description: Food pantry at First Presbyterian Church (513 Birch St, Boonton) serving Boonton and nearby communities; open Wednesdays 4–6pm and Saturdays 9–11am:contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}.
resources.eligibility: Individuals and families facing food insecurity

resources.name: First Reformed Church Food Pantry
resources.description: Food pantry at First Reformed Church (237 Washington St, Boonton) offering groceries to those in need; open Thursdays 3:30–5pm and the third Saturday 10am–12pm:contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}.
resources.eligibility: Residents of Boonton and families in need

resources.name: Boonton Housing Authority
resources.description: Public housing authority of the Town of Boonton providing safe, affordable housing to low-income families; operates 74 units in two complexes:contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}.

resources.name: Boonton Community Center
resources.description: Community center offering a variety of programs and services for residents of Boonton.

resources.name: Butler United Methodist Church Food Pantry
resources.description: Food pantry for Butler residents.

resources.name: Chester Food Pantry
resources.description: Food pantry for Chester Borough residents.

resources.name: Denville Township Food Pantry
resources.description: Food pantry for Denville Township residents.

resources.name: St. Clare’s Meals on Wheels
resources.description: Home-delivered meals for homebound seniors in Denville.

resources.name: First Memorial Presbyterian Church Food Pantry
resources.description: Food pantry in Dover.

resources.name: Zufall Health – Dover (Medical Center)
resources.description: Federally qualified community health center offering primary medical, dental and behavioral health care on a sliding fee scale.
resources.eligibility: All; accepts Medicaid and uninsured (sliding scale)

resources.name: Catholic Charities (CES – Morris County)
resources.description: Emergency rental/utility assistance program to prevent homelessness (HPRP); helps Morris County families pay back rent/deposits and stabilize housing.
resources.eligibility: Morris County residents at risk of homelessness

resources.name: Catholic Charities – Hope House Food Pantry (Dover)
resources.description: Food pantry (consumer-choice) run by Catholic Charities in Dover; provides groceries and hygiene items to low-income families (open Mon–Thu 9:30am–1:00pm, Thurs 4:00pm–6:00pm):contentReference[oaicite:10]{index=10}.

resources.name: Salvation Army of Dover (Lenape Valley Corps)
resources.description: Provides shelter and social services in Dover.

resources.name: Holy Family Church Food Pantry
resources.description: Food pantry at Holy Family Parish, Florham Park.

resources.name: Hurdtown United Methodist Church Food Pantry
resources.description: Food pantry serving Jefferson Township/Lake Hopatcong residents.

resources.name: Montville Township Health Department (Boonton Board of Health Clinics)
resources.description: Provides affordable health clinic services for Boonton Township residents through a partnership with Boonton Board of Health:contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}.
resources.eligibility: Underinsured or uninsured Boonton Township residents

resources.name: Family Promise of Morris County
resources.description: Organization providing shelter and support for families and individuals facing homelessness.

resources.name: Market Street Mission
resources.description: Emergency shelter and meals for men in Morristown.

resources.name: Salvation Army of Morristown
resources.description: Provides emergency shelter and support services.

resources.name: Morris County Office of Temporary Assistance
resources.description: County office providing financial and social services assistance.
resources.eligibility: Morris County residents meeting program criteria

resources.name: Atlantic Behavioral Health Services (Morristown Memorial)
resources.description: 24/7 psychiatric emergency and counseling services at Morristown Memorial Hospital.

resources.name: Our Promise Drop-In Resource Center
resources.description: Daytime resource center operated by Family Promise of Morris County for individuals experiencing homelessness; provides meals, referrals, and supportive services during open hours:contentReference[oaicite:8]{index=8}.

resources.name: Morris County Home-Delivered Meals
resources.description: Program delivering free weekly hot meals to homebound, low-income seniors and disabled residents of Morris County:contentReference[oaicite:11]{index=11}.
resources.eligibility: Morris County residents age 60+ or disabled and homebound

resources.name: Morris County Department of Human Services
resources.description: County agency offering broad social service programs: public assistance (healthcare, housing, food), financial aid, mental health, job training, youth prevention, veteran and disability support, senior services (including Meals on Wheels), and adult protective services:contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}.
resources.eligibility: Morris County residents in need of assistance

resources.name: Interfaith Food Pantry Network of Morris County
resources.description: Nonprofit network coordinating multiple food pantries and mobile distributions across Morris County to serve people facing hunger:contentReference[oaicite:9]{index=9}.
resources.eligibility: Morris County residents in need of food assistance

resources.description: Food pantry at St. Peter's Parish, Parsippany.

resources.name: First Reformed Church of Pequannock Food Pantry
resources.description: Food pantry at First Reformed Church, Pompton Plains.

resources.name: Chilton Memorial Hospital Psychiatric Services
resources.description: Hospital-based 24/7 crisis intervention services.

resources.name: Randolph Food Pantry
resources.description: Food pantry serving Randolph Township residents.

resources.name: Care Center of New Jersey (Rockaway Township Food Pantry)
resources.description: Food pantry serving the Rockaway area.

resources.name: Rockaway Food Closet
resources.description: Food pantry at First Presbyterian Church, Rockaway Borough.

resources.name: Roxbury Township Food Pantry
resources.description: Food pantry at the Succasunna Community Center, Roxbury Twp.

resources.name: Wharton United Community Church Food Pantry
resources.description: Food pantry at St. John's, Wharton.

resources.name: St. Mary’s Parish Food Pantry
resources.description: Food pantry at St. Mary’s in Wharton (also serves Dover).

resources.name: First Presbyterian Church of Whippany Food Pantry
resources.description: Food pantry serving Hanover Township/Whippany residents.

resources.name: Navigating Hope Outreach Program (Morris County)
resources.description: Mobile outreach van providing case management, benefits enrollment (SNAP, Medicaid, WIC, TANF, etc.), and other social service referrals to low-income and homeless individuals across Morris County:contentReference[oaicite:7]{index=7}.

resources.name: Bloomfield Presbyterian Church Food Pantry
resources.description: Church-run pantry open Wed and Fri mornings and fourth Sat to distribute food to Bloomfield residents with referrals required [oai_citation:0‡bplnj.org](https://www.bplnj.org/community-services#:~:text=Bloomfield%20Presbyterian%20Church%20Food%20Pantry).

resources.name: Caldwell Food Pantry
resources.description: Municipal food pantry serving Caldwell and West Caldwell residents, accepting donated food in the town's Health & Human Services Department [oai_citation:2‡caldwell-nj.com](https://caldwell-nj.com/index.asp?SEC=CAD355E1-3E86-4CA5-9CEA-3D9822135AA3&DE=BB80C3B5-CF88-4F76-A9C7-EC05254E4F21#:~:text=3.%20Pantry%20Drop,on%20the%20back%20of%20the).

resources.name: Isaiah House Emergency Family Shelter
resources.description: Provides emergency shelter for homeless families and single women in Essex County, with private rooms allowing families to stay together. Full supportive services and meals provided 24/7 [oai_citation:3‡isaiahhouse.org](https://isaiahhouse.org/our_work/emergency-family-shelter/#:~:text=Immediate%2C%20emergency%20housing%20is%20available,in%20crisis%20to%20stay%20together) [oai_citation:4‡isaiahhouse.org](https://isaiahhouse.org/our_work/emergency-family-shelter/#:~:text=Isaiah%20House%20welcomes%20all%20definitions,maintain%20eligibility%20in%20state%20and).

resources.name: Isaiah House Food Pantry
resources.description: Provides monthly food assistance to Essex County residents; clients can pick up a standard bag of groceries (for a family of 4) once per month [oai_citation:5‡isaiahhouse.org](https://isaiahhouse.org/our_work/food-pantry-in-kind-donations/#:~:text=For%20pickup%2C%20an%20ID%20is,for%20a%20household%20of%20four). ID required for pickup.
resources.eligibility: Residents in need (ID required, once per month)

resources.name: Irvington Neighborhood Improvement Corporation (INIC)
resources.description: Community service agency providing food pantry (4th Wed/Thu of month), daily soup kitchen (Mon–Fri 12–1pm lunch, 4–5pm dinner), and other support services for low-income Irvington residents [oai_citation:7‡irvingtonnj.gov](https://irvingtonnj.gov/irvington-neighborhood-improvement-corp/#:~:text=,during%20inclement%20weather).
resources.hours: Food pantry: 4th Wed & Thu monthly; Soup kitchen: Mon–Fri lunch 12pm–1pm, dinner 4pm–5pm [oai_citation:8‡irvingtonnj.gov](https://irvingtonnj.gov/irvington-neighborhood-improvement-corp/#:~:text=,during%20inclement%20weather)

resources.name: Cornerstone House (Salvation Army Montclair Citadel)
resources.description: 23-bed homeless shelter for families and individuals in suburban Essex County, providing overnight shelter and support. Open daily from 6pm to 8am [oai_citation:9‡montclair.salvationarmy.org](https://montclair.salvationarmy.org/montclair/housing-services#:~:text=In%20general%2C%20Cornerstone%20is%20opened,manager%20365%20days%20each%20year) [oai_citation:10‡montclairlibrary.org](https://montclairlibrary.org/wp-content/uploads/Community_Services_Resource_Guide.pdf#:~:text=DEVELOPMENT%20CORPORATION%20%28MNDC%29%2068%20N,FULLERTON%20AVE%2C%20MONTCLAIR%2C%20NJ%2007042).

resources.name: Planned Parenthood of Metropolitan NJ - Montclair Center
resources.description: Offers reproductive and sexual health services (family planning, STD testing, general healthcare) on a sliding fee scale [oai_citation:12‡montclairlibrary.org](https://montclairlibrary.org/wp-content/uploads/Community_Services_Resource_Guide.pdf#:~:text=29%20N%20FULLERTON%20AVE%2C%20MONTCLAIR%2C,PLANNED%20PARENTHOOD) [oai_citation:13‡npin.cdc.gov](https://npin.cdc.gov/organization/planned-parenthood-metropolitan-new-jersey-2#:~:text=29%20N%20Fullerton%20Ave%20Montclair%2C,NJ%2007042%20United%20States).

resources.name: Interfaith Hospitality Network (IHN) of Essex County
resources.description: Provides shelter and professional support for homeless families via local churches, helping them secure permanent housing [oai_citation:15‡bplnj.org](https://www.bplnj.org/community-services#:~:text=Interfaith%20Hospitality%20Network%20of%20Essex,other%20partners%20throughout%20our%20community).

resources.name: The Apostles' House - Emergency Shelter
resources.description: Emergency shelter for women and children, offering safe, drug-free housing and supportive services to homeless families in Newark [oai_citation:16‡theapostleshouse.org](https://theapostleshouse.org/women-and-children-emergency-shelter/#:~:text=The%20Apostles%27%20House%20,NJ) [oai_citation:17‡theapostleshouse.org](https://theapostleshouse.org/women-and-children-emergency-shelter/#:~:text=Our%20facilities%20are%20operational%20,365%20days%20a%20year%2C%2024%2F7).

resources.name: The Apostles' House Food Pantry
resources.description: Large community food pantry serving Newark, distributing groceries and meals multiple days per week to prevent hunger [oai_citation:19‡theapostleshouse.org](https://theapostleshouse.org/food-pantry/#:~:text=The%20Apostles%E2%80%99%20House%20Food%20Pantry,open%20multiple%20days%20per%20week) [oai_citation:20‡theapostleshouse.org](https://theapostleshouse.org/food-pantry/#:~:text=The%20pantry%20is%20located%20at,10%20AM%20to%203%20PM).
resources.eligibility: Individuals and families experiencing food insecurity

resources.name: Covenant House New Jersey (Youth Engagement Center)
resources.description: 24/7 homeless shelter for youth (ages 18–21, up to 24), providing dormitory living, meals, and support services. Always open to homeless youth in need [oai_citation:22‡covenanthousenj.org](https://covenanthousenj.org/find-support/immediate-services/#:~:text=,human%20trafficking%20of%20all%20ages) [oai_citation:23‡covenanthousenj.org](https://covenanthousenj.org/find-support/immediate-services/#:~:text=).

resources.name: New Community Emergency Food Pantry
resources.description: Monthly emergency food pantry at 220 Bruce St open weekdays, serving Newark residents in need with groceries (canned goods, produce, frozen items) [oai_citation:24‡newcommunity.org](https://www.newcommunity.org/emergency-food-pantry/#:~:text=New%20Community%20Corporation%20operates%20an,and%20even%20frozen%2C%20whole%20chickens) [oai_citation:25‡newcommunity.org](https://www.newcommunity.org/emergency-food-pantry/#:~:text=Food%20is%20distributed%20at%20220,while%20supplies%20last).
resources.eligibility: Individuals and families in need (NJ ID required) [oai_citation:27‡newcommunity.org](https://www.newcommunity.org/emergency-food-pantry/#:~:text=The%20food%20pantry%20requires%3A%20%E2%80%93,Social%20Security%20award%20letter%2C%20etc)

resources.name: YMCA of Newark and Vicinity — Emergency Residence Shelter
resources.description: Emergency residence shelter serving individuals and families, offering 300 beds, case‑management, community dining, laundry facilities, and supportive services including employment readiness, health screening, and housing search assistance.

resources.name: Interfaith Food Pantry of the Oranges
resources.description: Provides food assistance to residents of the Orange area through pantry distributions; serves Orange, East Orange, and West Orange [oai_citation:28‡westorange.org](https://westorange.org/247/Services#:~:text=1,Orange%2C%20NJ%2007050).
resources.eligibility: Residents of Orange, East Orange, and West Orange

resources.name: Holy Trinity Food Pantry
resources.description: Emergency food pantry run by Holy Trinity Church, distributing groceries to West Orange residents on scheduled days [oai_citation:29‡westorange.org](https://westorange.org/247/Services#:~:text=1,West%20Orange%2C%20NJ%2007052).

resources.name: Zufall Community Health Center - West Orange
resources.description: FQHC providing medical and dental care (family medicine, pediatrics, OB/GYN, HIV services, dental) on a sliding fee scale [oai_citation:30‡zufallhealth.org](https://www.zufallhealth.org/about-us/locations/west-orange-medical-dental/#:~:text=Services).
resources.hours: Mon 8am–5pm; Tue 8am–6pm; Wed 8am–6pm; Thu 8am–5pm; Fri 8am–5pm; Sat 8am–1pm [oai_citation:31‡zufallhealth.org](https://www.zufallhealth.org/about-us/locations/west-orange-medical-dental/#:~:text=,8%3A00%20AM%20%E2%80%93%201%3A00%20PM)
